events.name: StackUp Tech Talk: Machine Learning in Robotics
events.description:
The scale and pace of businesses around the world today has made automation a crucial part of any enterprise. Robots in both tangible and intangible forms assist and, in some cases, lead processes. In this StackUp Tech Talk, the science behind a robotic brain is covered. Join us and get a glimpse of how intelligent systems make decisions and how they can learn to improve over time. 
Agenda:

Introduction to Reinforcement Learning
Knowledge Reprsentation
Decision Making and Learning Algorithms
Deep Neural Networks and Robotics
Scalable Intelligent Systems

Speaker: Abhinit Ambastha
Speaker: Abhinit Ambastha Abhinit is a PhD candidate at NUS School of Computing and a Guest Lecturer at NUS ISS StackUp Group. His current research interests are in the fields of AI, deep neural networks, reinforcement learning, knowledge representation, and theoretical machine learning that are especially applicable but not limited to the areas of medical prognosis and rehabilitation.
Reserving a Seat:
Enter the promotional code that accompanies the invitation email sent to you to reserve a seat. Seats for the general public will be available on February 13, 2017.
events.location: StackUp Studio, 79 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #02-09, Singapore 139955

events.name: TensorFlow and Deep Learning : First Event
events.description: Our first event is planned to follow hot-on-the-heels of the TensorFlow Summit in Mountain View, and we'll have three talks to cover the range of experience that we hope will attend :  1.  Building your first models : Sam will present a crash course into TensorFlow and how to construct models quickly using either raw TensorFlow or a wrapper like Keras. 2.  So that you don't have to stay up through the night to watch the 2017 TensorFlow Summit in real-time, we'll summarize the major announcements and developments for you. 3.  We'll round things out with an "aiming higher" talk, in which Martin will explore something closer to the academic 'cutting edge' using models built in TensorFlow - using either raw TensorFlow, Keras or one of the (many) sugaring libraries. We'll also do a bit of 'show-of-hands' just to understand what people are interested in seeing and/or presenting.  Because this is a "TensorFlow Summit" related event, Google has generously offered to sponsor some food - so expect pizza (unless there are compelling suggestions in the comments below).
events.location: Google Asia Pacific, 70 Pasir Panjang Road, #03-71, Mapletree Business City, , Singapore

events.name: Gophers Meetup #19 - Feb 2016
events.description:
Let's celebrate Go 1.8 release party! Venue: Singapore Power Office 


AGENDA • 7pm: Networking & food & drink • 7:20: Introduction  • 7:30pm: Talks • 9pm: End 



TALKS • More understanding on using Go with (SQL) database, Mark Khiem @exklamationmark • Serverless Golang, Kai Hendry @kaihendry • What is new in Go 1.8, John Hua  If you have plan to talk about new features or discuss any topic of Golang. Please contact me at sg.gopher@gmail.com
events.location: Singapore Power, 240 Tanjong Pagar Road #08-00 Singapore 088540

events.name: talk.js with Douglas Crockford
events.description: This month's talk.js we are really excited to once again welcome Douglas Crockford back to Singapore to address the developer community in Singapore. This event is sponsored by PayPal. Seats are limited so please RSVP. Agenda Post JavaScript Apocalypse - Douglas Crockford About the speaker Douglas Crockford is best known for his ongoing involvement in the development of the JavaScript language, for having popularized JSON, and for developing various JavaScript tools such as JSLint and JSMin. He is the author of JavaScript: The Good Parts. He is currently a senior JavaScript architect at PayPal, and is also a writer and speaker on JavaScript, JSON, and related web technologies. Location PayPal SingaporeSuntec Tower 55 Temasek Boulevard #09-01Singapore Drinks and food sponsored by PayPal Remember to bring your photo ID to get through building security Feel free to chat with us on Gitter https://gitter.im/SingaporeJS/discussions
events.location: PayPal Singapore, Suntec Tower 5, 5 Temasek Boulevard #09-01

events.name: Singapore Magento User Group Meetup - Feb 2017
events.description:
Date: Thursday, 16 Feb 2016 Venue: Microsoft Singapore, One Marina Boulevard Level 22,[masked], Singapore Time: 7:00 - 9:00PM Conference room: 22CF-15 Agenda:  Magento Integration with Salesforce Marketing Cloud by Shivendra Singh. Shivendra is working as System Analyst in Ranosys Technologies and his main focus is to help building robust web applications. This talk will be on integration planning and strategy of Salesforce marketing cloud with Magento. 


Want to speak or share your experience with community? Send message or comment below. Connect with us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/groups/SingaporeMagentoUserGroup/<a href="https://www.meetup.com/Singapore-Magento-User-Group/"></a> Pizza and drink are sponsor by Microsoft Singapore :)
events.location: Microsoft Singapore, One Marina Boulevard, Level 22, 018989, Singapore

events.name: Elm Singapore February Meetup
events.description: It is time to mark your calendars for the next Elm Singapore Meetup, and this time we are happy to have Honestbee as our host and food sponsor! Based on all the great ideas put forward by you at our last Meetup, the proposal for this event is to have a participatory Coding Dojo where we go from "Hello World" to full working application, including time for addressing the questions you may have. Program: - Pizza and networking. Sponsored by Honestbee. - Introductions and gathering of Ideas and Questions Open Space style - Coding Dojo: The Elm Singapore Feedback Timer App - Feedback round using the new App. Don't forget that you can join the preparation chatter on the Elm Slack Singapore Channel Looking forward to seeing you there!
events.location: Honestbee, #04-01B Delta House, 2 Alexandra Road, 159919, Singapore

events.name: ArtScience Late: Marsband
events.description:
ArtScience Late: MARSBAND

Thu, 16 Feb | 8pm
Expression Gallery, Level 4
Free

What is it like to be in space? Go on a magic carpet ride on Mars with MARSBAND! Traverse unknown terrains, discover new frontiers, and experience the fantastical atmosphere of life in deep space, with live scoring by Carter Emmart and Keith Patchel.

8pm-10pm Stargazing 
by SINGASTRO

This programme is part of the Art and Science of Space season
